title: You're Not Bad with Money, You're Just Overwhelmed: Here’s Why You’ll Be Okay
subtitle: Understanding the complexities of personal finance and how to simplify your approach.
content:
You're Not Bad with Money, You're Just Overwhelmed: Here’s Why You’ll Be Okay

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio.

1. The Financial Tool Overload

There are 8,000 financial tools, 11 types of IRAs, and approximately three TikTok bros yelling at you to buy real estate that you can't afford. Of course, you're confused!

2. It's About Bandwidth, Not IQ

We often act like being good with money is all about IQ, but it’s really about bandwidth. If you're burned out, even a basic weekly budget feels like another unpaid job.

3. Focus on Five Key Habits

Most of what you need comes down to five habits. The rest is just less noise with better marketing. So you're not broken; the system is just too loud.
